channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: In Search of the Elusive Neutral Interest Rate
item.description: With Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell's semiannual address to the Senate Banking Committee this week fresh in mind, it is an ideal time to consider the drivers of r*.

item.title: Omega owner Swatch Group’s moment has passed as profits drop 70% in 6 months: ‘The big impact is really mainly China’
item.description: The company’s key Omega brand may be suffering from more availability of models at retail from rival Rolex, the top Swiss watch brand.

item.title: Commodities for the Long Run?
item.description: Asset classes such as commodities have historically had notable diversification benefits for longer-term investors who are concerned with inflation.

item.title: Qualcomm sues China’s Transsion, the ‘Smartphone King of Africa,’ for infringing on its patents
item.description: Transsion has almost half of Africa's smartphone market and the company is expanding in South Asia and other emerging markets.

item.title: Vanguard’s Former OCIO Clients Must Stand Their Ground
item.description: Vanguard's OCIO clients should be wary of the higher-fee active funds and alternative investments that are now open to them.

item.title: Thailand is trying to create a ‘whirlwind’ in its economy with a $14 billion program that includes handouts to almost anyone over the age of 16
item.description: An estimated 50 million Thais 16 years and older are qualified to receive 10,000 baht ($276) each under the so-called digital wallet scheme.

item.title: Are Your Data Governance and Management Practices Keeping Pace with the AI Boom?
item.description: No matter how sophisticated and expensive a firm's AI tools are, it should not forget that the principle “garbage in, garbage out” (GIGO) applies to the entire investment management process.

item.title: ‘Football is seldom ever just about sports’—this year’s European Championship demonstrated how waves of immigration have redefined sports
item.description: Young footballers of color such as Nico Williams and Barcelona’s 16-year-old Lamine Yamal still face personal abuse.

item.title: Book Review: Default
item.description: Argentina’s debt restructuring tests the theoretical limits of chaos theory. Gregory Makoff's feat is to build his narrative as a thriller without losing the detailed facts valued by specialists.

item.title: Texas Gov. Greg Abbott slams power company CenterPoint as 270,000 homes and businesses remain without power after Hurricane Beryl
item.description: “Power companies along the Gulf Coast must be prepared to deal with hurricanes, to state the obvious,” Abbott said at his first news conference about Beryl.
